column4: My network configuration (laptop) hangs for a long time at boot. My guess is it tries to activate eth0 (wireless) even thou it is disabled in /etc/network/interfaces. Can anyone help - it's very annoying
and manually ifup it. I know - still very annoying
no. In the end it gives up and all is OK, it's just takes more than a minute
dmesg  | grep eth0 ==> eth0: no IPv6 routers present
I am pretty sure it *does* try - I want to disable it!
well, i have button on my hp
Yes I have the wireless turned off in hardware
just one thing come on my mind
blacklist kernel module for your wlan card
If I want to post a bug report, where should it go?
